Wendy Meredith McConnel, the daughter of Nancy and Matthew McConnel of Searsmont, Me., was married yesterday to John Kristin Sirchio, a son of Wanda G. Hill of Sarasota, Fla., and the late Cosmo Sirchio. The Rev. Bryan J. Sirchio, a brother of the bridegroom and a United Church of Christ minister, performed the ceremony at the Vesper Hill Children's Chapel in Rockport, Me.
The couple graduated from Duke University.

Mrs. Sirchio, 32, is a first secretary for human rights and consular issues at the American Embassy in Vienna. From 1996 to 1998, she was an adviser on environmental issues at the American Mission to the United Nations.

Her parents are retired teachers. Her father taught mathematics and science at the Vermont Academy, a private high school in Saxons River. Her mother taught the third grade at the Country School, a private school in Easton, Md. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.

Mr. Sirchio, 34, is known as Kris. Until June he was a marketing director in Vienna for Procter & Gamble; in October he is to take a similar position with the company in Brussels. He founded the Sirchio Foundation for Youth, a leadership organization for teenagers in Flint, Mich. He received an M.B.A. from Southern Methodist University. His father was a fashion designer in New York. The bridegroom is a stepson of Guy H. Hill, who retired as a partner in the Flint law firm of Gault, Davison, Bowers & Hill.
